item.title: Jagex are on to me!
item.dc:creator: @kyled123 kyled123
item.description:
@kyled123 wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:34, topic:167299”][quote author=Evan` link=topic=226688.msg1951067#msg1951067 date=1198520462]
Can’t find that i386 file
[/quote]legit you fixed it for me i did what you said and they had runescape.com/paypal/tip.it and all kinds of other websites redirected to something else but i did what you said and it worked omg thanks a lot your ownage!!!

Just hit WinKey + F, and click All File and Folders. Type in hosts in the top box. Search, there should only be one file named hosts without an extension. Click Open, then select Notepad.

Mine was in C:\WINDOWS\system32\drivers\etc[/quote]

Read full topic

Can’t find that i386 file

Just hit WinKey + F, and click All File and Folders. Type in hosts in the top box. Search, there should only be one file named hosts without an extension. Click Open, then select Notepad.

Mine was in C:\WINDOWS\system32\drivers\etc

item.title: Jagex are on to me!
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

OS - Operating System - If you are using Windows XP… Look for a file in the following folder:
c:\windows\i386\hosts

Its a standard text file, that can be used to redirect your browser to another site without your knowledge (I have NO idea why Microsoft thought that this was a good idea)

Anyway… you can right click it, and choose open with, and just use notepad, any information about runescape (Or anything that might even be slightly runescape related) can be deleted (Actually the whole file can just be killed, completely useless)… but if you don’t want to do that step, than just look around in there and see if there is any runescape related anything in there, and kill the lines in that file…

This is what the current page of RuneScape looks like, If you don’t see this page… don’t trust it…

Tryed a different browser? IE, FireFox, Seamonkey, (The last two are from mozilla.org, but everyone has heard of firefox, i’m sure)… Depending on what you usually use, try a different one, and update your Java console (Http://www.sun.com). You might have a hack version of Java, that is designed to steal your password.

Let me know if any of this helps… if not:

THIS IS A LAST DITCH EFFORT…

Registry hack

WARNING: IF you don’t know what your doing for this… you could SERIOUSLY hurt your PC’s System settings, Operating systems related stuff… If done bad enough could require a format:

Press the Windows button and while its pressed, press “R”. A box will show up, enter “Regedit” and Press enter.

This will open your Registry Editor. Press CTRL-F, and type in Runescape. IT’ll Take a while, but if there is a registry hack that redirects you, it’ll find it, if you find anything in there… post it here before doing anything.

Read full topic
